keyFactors.description: Edmonton played Capitals previous night (lost 5-3), now traveling to Tampa. Back-to-back road teams in NHL cover only 43% against rested home teams. McDavid and Draisaitl's legs will be heavy.

keyFactors.description: Big Cat 4-1 in last 5 starts with 2.22 GAA and .917 SV%. Elite goaltending vs poor goaltending is massive edge in NHL. Expect Lightning to win goaltending battle decisively.

quarterBreakdown.description: Even period with both teams trading goals. Kucherov opened scoring for Tampa at 7:22. McDavid answered at 14:55. Oilers showing fatigue but McDavid's individual brilliance kept them in it.
Lightning took control. Guentzel scored at 3:18, Point added at 11:42. Oilers' fatigue became evident - slow skating, losing puck battles. Tampa outshot Edmonton 13-7 in period.
Tampa sealed it with Cirelli goal at 6:44 (4-2 lead). Draisaitl pulled one back at 15:32 but too little too late. Oilers pulled goalie but couldn't complete comeback. Final: 4-2 Lightning.

gameResults.whenCleared: Second period's 2-0 advantage (3-1 overall lead) secured the bet. Oilers' fatigue showed with slow skating and lost puck battles. Lightning's depth overwhelmed tired Edmonton.
gameResults.turningPoint: Guentzel's goal 3:18 into second period gave Tampa 2-1 lead and momentum. Oilers couldn't respond with tired legs. Point's goal 8 minutes later (3-1) put game away.
gameResults.gamePace: Lightning controlled pace in 2nd and 3rd periods. Limited Oilers' transition opportunities - only 26 SOG for Edmonton. Tampa's fresh legs won board battles and races to loose pucks.
gameResults.teamOffense: Balanced attack with 4 different scorers (Kucherov, Guentzel, Point, Cirelli). Kucherov's 3-point night led the way. 31 shots on weak Pickard produced 4 goals.

whatWentRight.title: Back-to-Back Fatigue Materialized
whatWentRight.description: Oilers visibly tired in 2nd period - slow skating, losing puck battles, couldn't sustain pressure. Exactly as modeled for B2B road teams.

whatWentRight.title: Goaltending Edge Decisive
whatWentRight.description: Vasilevskiy .923 SV% vs Pickard .871 SV%. Elite goalie vs bad goalie was game-deciding factor. Vasy made key saves, Pickard couldn't steal it.

whatWentRight.title: Lightning Depth Overwhelmed
whatWentRight.description: 4 different goal scorers showed Tampa's depth vs Edmonton's top-heavy attack. When McDavid/Draisaitl (1G, 1A combined) can't take over, Oilers lose.

whatWentRight.title: Second Period Dominance
whatWentRight.description: 2-0 period for Lightning (3-1 lead) was knockout punch. Fresh legs vs tired legs in middle frame exactly as expected.

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: No. This was textbook situational spot - back-to-back road team with bad goalie vs rested home team with elite goalie. Every thesis materialized. Fatigue showed in 2nd period, goaltending edge decisive, Lightning depth overwhelmed. Process-driven win.

closingLineValue.verdict: Slight positive CLV. Line moved from -165 to -170 as money came in on Lightning. We captured original number. Back-to-back situations are well-known edges so line movement expected.

keyTakeaways: Back-to-back road teams are elite fade spots - fatigue is real in NHL
Goaltending matchups matter most - Vasilevskiy vs Pickard was mismatch
Second periods often decide games when fatigue factor exists
McDavid/Draisaitl can be contained when team is tired - they're human
Lightning depth (4 different scorers) overwhelms top-heavy teams
Situational handicapping in NHL is +EV - rest advantages are quantifiable
verdict: Perfect execution of situational NHL handicapping. Back-to-back road team with worst goalie situation in NHL vs rested home team with elite Vasilevskiy. Every thesis materialized: fatigue showed in 2nd period (2-0 Lightning), goaltending edge decisive (Vasy .923 vs Pickard .871), depth overwhelmed top-heavy Oilers. McDavid limited to single goal despite 8 SOG. This is exploitable edge - would bet this spot repeatedly.
